message: Although this article is published on 2012, but it's still relevant to today's challenges, and I encourage everyone to see what s/he is missing and then move on to cover those 10 things.
story: Mohammed El Sayed shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Top 10 Simple Things Every Computer User Should Know How to Do
caption: lifehacker.com
description: No matter how tech savvy you are, there are certain things every one of us has to deal with when using a computer—and we don't always deal with them in the most efficient ways. Here are 10 things that everyone can (and should) learn to keep their computer fast, safe, and easy to use.

data.message: We don't control our users. Quite often we don't get to influence them away from our app. This concept starting from the title then going to details is completely broken, and should be an anti-pattern of thinking for any successful worker in the "user servicing" sector, especially the computer area of it.
Mohamed Meligy: انا مش فاهم حاجه :)
يعني احنا مالناش نقول اليوزر المفروض يعرف ايه. يعرف اللي يعرفه، و لو اللي مايعرفوش يؤثر علينا دي مشكلتنا احنا مش مشكلته هو. احنا مش بننقي يوزرس (على الأقل كديفيلوبرز يعني مش برودكت أونرز).
The user doesn't know what is good for him, we know better and we are smarter than him, so that is how it goes :)
